image.altText: A composite image of Jeremy Rockliff and Dean Winter facing each other in parliament.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's new parliament is meeting to test confidence in Liberal premier Jeremy Rockliff's government in the lower house. Follow live.

title.children: Motion of no confidence moved in Tasmanian premier Jeremy Rockliff

image.altText: Man in suit talking at a press conference

props.synopsis: With Labor's stubbornness to entertain any compromise to appease crossbenchers whose support it needed for today's vote in the Tasmanian parliament, it'll need all that hard-won backbone for another term on the Opposition benches.

title.children: With vote set to fail, Tasmanian Labor eyeing yet another term in opposition

image.altText: a man with brown hair and glasses in a blue checked shirt

props.synopsis: Artificial eye maker Jack McDonald has been ordered to stop operating while the Health Complaints Commissioner in Victoria continues an investigation into him.

title.children: Artificial eye maker ordered to stop working while investigation underway

image.altText: A high school student poses with her mobile showing her social media applications.

props.synopsis: While social media is a popular way to share information, Crime Stoppers and police are warning about the potential risks of sharing crimes online.

title.children: Dobbing in a criminal? Don't do it on social media

image.altText: Salmon pens photographed through trees.

props.synopsis: The chief executive of Salmon Tasmania says the decision to pause marine farming expansion is "shameless" and contradicts promises made by Premier Jeremy Rockliff in July.

title.children: 'No industry is safe': Salmon workers respond to halt on fish farm growth

image.altText: Children smiling for a photo in a library wearing costumes of storybook characters

props.synopsis: While some people love the chance to get creative with book week costumes, others see it as an expensive chore. Costume libraries are offering outfits to students, to make sure everyone is included.

title.children: Book week can be expensive and stressful but donated costumes are helping

image.altText: albanese roundtable

props.synopsis: The economic reform roundtable discusses the prospect of streamlining skills recognition for qualified migrants. Follow live.

title.children: Roundtable discusses streamlining skills recognition for migrants

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers

props.synopsis: Problem and productivity. It's a pairing that has become inseparable in recent times, given our productivity growth is the lowest in half a century.

title.children: Population and property are the taboo topics of productivity talkfest

image.altText: Man walks past CSL signage

props.synopsis: Biotech giant CSL has announced major changes as its profit rises, but investors have sold off the stock. The ASX falls after mixed moves on Wall Street. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: CSL shares dive as biotech firm flags more than 3,000 job cuts

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Cyber attack exposes details of thousands of internet provider iiNet's customers
Jump in consumer confidence is 'welcome news'
CSL shares slump 14pc on profit results and demerger plan

image.altText: Two serious young men, sit on window of grey metal building, one holds the other, white dog, black markings, plants.

props.synopsis: Josh Heins and Manu Bohn believe their tiny home on wheels does not need approval, but their local council does not agree.

title.children: Couple faces eviction amid calls for clarity on laws for tiny homes

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja in a dark room looking at a man in a business suit

props.synopsis: The findings from South Australia's landmark Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence have been released nine months after the first public hearings were held, and amid expectations of sweeping changes to address abuse.

title.children: 'Lead with courage' DV royal commissioner urges, as findings released

image.altText: David Sevelle prays with a Thai monk behind him

props.synopsis: New Zealand's financial watchdog has issued a warning about an embattled internet scheme founded by an Australian with a colourful past.

title.children: NZ authorities' warning over Aussie's controversial 'ethical' internet

image.altText: A hole in the ground in the shape of a thin rectangle, with a group of people standing around it

props.synopsis: The Assad family's rule was among the most brutal in the region and its prison system, including feared sites such as Saydnaya, was notorious for disappearing people without a trace.

title.children: Over 300,000 Syrians may have gone missing during Assad regime

image.altText: WA Chief Justice Peter Quinlan speaks to ABC WA State Political Reporter Keane Bourke

props.synopsis: WA's chief justice says everyone should be worried about the rise of 'sovereign citizens' who do not believe in the law, warning of the risks to "the safety and stability" of society.

title.children: WA's top judge issues warning over rise of 'sovereign citizens'

image.altText: A man warms up with an AFL ball

props.synopsis: Adelaide veteran Taylor Walker says a verdict is expected to be handed down on Tuesday into an alleged homophobic slur made by teammate Izak Rankine as calls ramp up to stop discrimination in sport.

title.children: Teammate says Rankine 'remorseful', as Crows await AFL investigation findings

image.altText: Alex de Minaur of Australia and Katie Boulter of Great Britain during the Mixed Doubles second-round match during Wimbledon

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur's quest to play doubles at the US Open is rejected, as Nick Kyrgios pulls out of the newly formatted draw.

title.children: De Minaur rejected for new US Open doubles format as Kyrgios pulls out

image.altText: A young First Nations woman sits on a chair with paintings behind her

props.synopsis: Ever wished you could get paid to do what you do for fun? Three people share what it's really like.

title.children: 'It's no longer just about the ride': Turning a hobby into a job

image.altText: A woman holding a stack of fluffy blankets and cushions.

props.synopsis: While the health effects of inhaling and consuming microplastics are not yet fully known, we asked a microplastics researcher how they minimise contact with them.

title.children: Want to reduce microplastics in your home? Here's where to start

image.altText: a baby in bandages

props.synopsis: In August last year, a stranger allegedly threw a thermos of hot coffee on the nine-month-old baby, in what police described as a "savage attack".

title.children: Mother of baby burned in 'savage' coffee attack makes plea for justice

image.altText: Police car with street blocked by police tape.

props.synopsis: Police found the 32-year-old woman's body about 5am this morning.

title.children: Man arrested after woman found dead in Cobram home

image.altText: A large white sign showing a coat of arms and the words "local court".

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory coroner has heard that a young mother was "crying out to police" for help in the lead-up to a horrific attempted murder-suicide in Darwin two years ago.

title.children: Woman 'crying out to police' months prior to attempted murder-suicide

image.altText: Bendigo Spirit players and coaches celebrate with the WNBL trophy and confetti

props.synopsis: Tasmania receives a licence as a part of the WNBL's expansion, which will see the competition go from having eight clubs to 10.

title.children: WNBL confirms expansion with Tasmania set to end 30-year hiatus

image.altText: a fossil of a pearl next to a scale showing its nearly 2cm wide

props.synopsis: An "incredibly valuable" prehistoric pearl slightly larger than a typical marble is verified as more than 100 million years old, after its discovery in north-west Queensland.

title.children: Tourist digs up 100-million-year-old pearl in the outback

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Matthew Perry, wearing clear plastic-rimmed glasses, a black suit jacked and a grey v-neck shirt.

props.synopsis: Jasveen Sangha is the fifth and final defendant to be charged with the actor's death.

title.children: 'Ketamine Queen' to plead guilty to selling drugs that killed Matthew Perry

image.altText: Grey smoke billows into the clear sky as multiple destroyed buildings are struck

props.synopsis: Hamas says it has accepted a new proposal from Arab mediators for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip as Israel indicates its stance on the war has not changed.

title.children: Hamas accepts Arab ceasefire proposal, Palestinian death toll passes 62,000

image.altText: A man sitting in an armchair wearing a blue shirt and jacket. There is a walking stick beside him.

props.synopsis: Ray Hildridge had quadruple bypass surgery in 1982 when renowned heart surgeon Victor Chang was one of few doing the procedure. His survival at 78 has set a world record.

title.children: Man's heart surgery at 34 sets a record that 'may never be broken'

image.altText: Students working on computers at school

props.synopsis: Once banned, generative AI chatbots are now present in some Australian classrooms. But experts warn we need to approach their integration with caution.

title.children: 'Genie not going back in the bottle': Why AI in schools is here to stay

image.altText: Group of tradesmen

props.synopsis: A former Victorian property developer turns his hand towards creating housing for the homeless, warning the crisis is stifling productivity and services.

title.children: Calls for private sector help in a housing crisis 'too big for government'

image.altText: A car on fire in a suburban street.

props.synopsis: NSW Police are continuing to hunt for the gunman responsible for shooting a man dead and seriously wounding another, after a burnt-out luxury car was found in Sydney's north-west overnight.

title.children: Police examining burnt-out sports car possible link to Sydney pub shooting

image.altText: A NSW POlice officer stands behind a police vehicle with tape across the road in the background.

props.synopsis: Police have established a crime scene on the street where a 22-year-old man was shot in the chest at Wardell, south of Ballina.

title.children: Victim 'not cooperating' with police after shooting on NSW north coast

image.altText: People hold umbrellas in cold wet windy weather

props.synopsis: Sydney's wettest August in nearly 30 years has tipped the city's recent climate into uncharted territory.

title.children: Sydney records most rain since weather station opened in 1858

image.altText: A car with an L-plate painted on

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has flagged potential changes to the state's learner licence scheme, including the requirement for 100 hours of supervised driving.

title.children: Queensland's learner licence scheme could be set for a shake-up

image.altText: A young man with blond hair combed back, blue eyes and wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The prosecutor in charge of the case says Marius Borg Høiby's membership of the royal family should not allow him to be treated more lightly.

title.children: Son of Norway crown princess charged with rape, dozens of other offences

image.altText: Biddy Connor holds a microphone up to the control panel of an IV machine. There is a bright pink light projected onto them.

props.synopsis: Sound artists show beauty can still be found in a world full of technology, even the noise of IV machines and AI chatbots.

title.children: The sounds of machines can be annoying, but these artists are making them beautiful
